result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J. Winkler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*All medications from one pharmacy.
*Sign all necessary releases so his agent can monitor what type of medications he is on and medical records.
*Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.
*No contact with Joshua White with the exception of a letter of apology within the first 30 days of probation and that goes to the agent for approval to make sure it is sincere.
*Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
*First 6 months must be in jail.  Last 6 months can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
*Huber for employment and counseling he may be involved in.
*Sentence to commence within 60 days.
*Must report today for start date and time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF324, 14CF409, 15CF4, 15CF26

3:30 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF324 - GUILTY
15CF4 Counts 2, 3 & 4 - NO CONTEST
15CF26 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following: 
14CF324  (Defendant agrees to the prior conviction).
15CF4 Counts 2, 3 & 4 - 
15CF26 Count 1
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

Dismissed and read-in are the following: 
15CF4 Count 1
15CF26 Count 2
14CF409

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Schmidt re: jail credit. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF4 Count 2
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months:
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All medicationss from 1 pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so his agent can monitor what type of medications he is on and medical records. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and with the approval of his agent. 
Maintain fulltime employment or go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.
No contact with Joshua White with the exception of a letter of apology within the first 30 days of probation and that goes to the agent for approval to make sure it is sincere. 
Submit a DNA sample.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Serve 1 year jail. 
70 days credit. 
First 6 months must be in jail.  Last 6 months can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time.
Pay restitution of $150 to Joshua White.  

15CF4 Count 3 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent with Count 2:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 2. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 1 year jail. 
70 days credit. 
First 6 months must be in jail.  Last 6 months can be on GPS electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Huber for employment and counseling he may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time.

15CF4 Count 4 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Counts 2 & 3. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CF26 Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent with his other probations:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF4. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
69 days jail credit.

14CF324 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 36 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 15CF4.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Atty Schmidt agrees there is no pre-trial incarceration credit in 14CF324. 

BY THE COURT:  Any bond posted in any of the files is to be applied to restitution/fines/costs.  Any balance left over can be returned to the posters of the bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
PCJP Day Report Oversite - original filed in 14CF324

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Current bond $5,000 cash bond with same previous conditions except for Amended the Day Report Condition to:   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7

9/9/15:  Bond is amended by stipulation and order to day report 4 times per week.  /s/TTF 9/4/15

1/26/16: Bond is amended in Court to day report back to 7 times per week. TTF 1/26/16

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-409, 15CF-4, 15CF-26 and 14CF-324.

2:32 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea today.

Court has been handed a motion to withdraw.

Atty Renc addresses the Court as to the motion to withdraw.

Atty Renc is concerned the communication is not there for the kind of representation Defendant deserves.

Defendant addresses the Court, if there is miscommunication, best interest would be is to have another attorney.

Court takes a moment to review the files and motion.

Court addresses the parties. Defendant paid the balance of the bond in 15CF-4 - $5,000.
Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding written stip that the number of day report days was reduced, explains the reduction.

Defendant was just laid off from Worzalla and Sons Potatoes.
Public Defender's office will appoint another attorney. 

These cases are going on almost a year and a half old. Matter was set for a plea today, there was a request for change of counsel for reasons as to relationship being broken.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants request. Atty Renc may withdraw.
Public Defender's office will appoint a new attorney within 48 hours.
Matters will be put back on the next pretrial calendar.
Court willl modify the bond in 15CF-4 to day report 7 times per week.
Other bonds will continue.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Current bond $5,000 cash bond with same previous conditions except for Amended the Day Report Condition to:   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7

9/9/15:  Bond is amended by stipulation and order to day report 4 times per week.  /s/TTF 9/4/15

11:00 a.m. Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Renc request bond modification of Day Report 14 to 7 days per week and delay payment for bond and resume payment after June 15.  ADA Knaapen states objections.

BTC: Current bond $5,000 cash bond with same previous conditions except for Amended the Day Report Condition to:   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Cash bond to remain at $5,000.00 but defendant will need to pay $2,500.00 to be released and then will have to pay $200 every two weeks until the remaining balance is paid.
Reside with parents at 1540 Torun Road, Lot No. 2 in Stevens Point, WI  54481
Report 4 times per week to Day Report. 
All other bond conditions remain the same.

9/9/15: Day report requirement lowerd to four (4) times per week.

Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has 4 cases: 14CF324, 14CF409, 15CF4 and 15CF26.
Case heard today was 15CF4.

10:30 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Renc is requesting a bond reduction in 15CF4 from $5,000.00 cash bond to $2,500.00 cash bond and states this on the record.
Atty Knaapen makes argument regarding the bond reduction and states if on the record.
Atty Renc replies to the statements of Atty Knaapen.
Court questions Atty Renc regarding where the money for the bond is to be coming from; Atty Renc makes statement.
Parents of the defendant are in court today and the Court asks that one of the parents come to the front of the courtroom.
Mother of the defendant, Leah Winkler, is questioned by the Court.
Court questions Atty Renc.
BY THE COURT:
Bond will remain at $5,000.00 but can be released once $2,500.00 is paid and then will have to pay $200.00 per week until the remaining balance is paid.
Plea hearing on March 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.

10:33 a.m. Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases: 14CF409, 15CF4, 15CF26, and 14CF324 were scheduled for plea hearing.  
Case 15CF4 is the only case being heard for a Bond Modification today.
Atty Renc states reasons for bond reduction down to $2,500.00.
ADA Knaapen states objections to the Bond Modification.

BY THE COURT:  15CF4 Motion is denied and Bond remains the same.

ADA Knaapen and Atty Renc to further discuss next hearing for the cases and will provide a Pretrial sheet later to the Court.
Plea hearing on February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

15CF3: Defendant Eli J. Eckerson in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF4: Defendant Dylan J. Winkler in court, in custody, with attorney Anne Renc.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Detective J. Lawrynk is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Knaapen. 
Witness identifies the defendant, Dylan J. Winkler. 
Atty Kryshak stipulates to the identification of Eli Eckerson.
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak. 
Cross exam by Atty Renc. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Informations.
Defendants received copy of information.
Defendants waive reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$5,000 cash bond:  No contact with victim, Joshua White or his residence or Eli Eckerson.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dylan J. Winkler appeared by phone. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dylan J. Winkler appeared by video.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State requests a $5,000 cash bond:  No contact with Joshua White or Eli Eckerson.
Atty Renc requests sig bond.
BTC:   $5,000 cash bond:  No contact with victim, Joshua White or his residence or Eli Eckerson.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
